Since JIRA 4.4.4 some configurations of Exchange smtp mailboxes are receiving errors when connecting to the mailbox.

{noformat}

at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:143)

at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717)
at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:290)
...
Caused by: javax.mail.AuthenticationFailedException: No authentication mechansims supported by both server and client
at com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPTransport.authenticate(SMTPTransport.java:756)
at com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPTransport.protocolConnect(SMTPTransport.java:669)
at javax.mail.Service.connect(Service.java:317)

at javax.mail.Service.connect(Service.java:125)
at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.send(SMTPMailServerImpl.java:154)

I think this came about from a change in javamail. Versions earlier than 4.4.4 use javamail 1.4.1 and the newer versions use 1.4.4. 

Workaround:
[JIRA KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/%27No+authentication+mechansims+supported+by+both+server+and+client%27+when+Configuring+Microsoft+Exchange+SMTP+Server]

The document at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server does not specifically handle the use-case of maintaining a staging server. For example:

# Disable mail handlers
# Pointing any applinks to other dev instances
# Recommendation to change the color in the UI, so staff know they are on a dev server
(/) You may also wish to use a custom icon and favicon, preferably ones that are brash and "in your face".
# Where to get a dev server license

Also that doc talks about upgrading.

----

*UPDATE:*

The [Migrating JIRA to Another Server|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server] document _*is not the correct page for this doc task*_.

The instructions for creating a staging server are documented on [Establishing Staging Server Environments for JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Establishing+Staging+Server+Environments+for+JIRA].

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27613].
  {panel}

*Background*
JIRA does not natively support the idea of field level security (JRA-1330), the most popular of which is the ability to the hide Time Tracking fields from customers (JRA-2364). We know that a lot of customers really want a way for JIRA to solve this kind of problem. 

*View Ports*
Internally at Atlassian we have been throwing around the idea of what we call "View Ports". The idea behind this is that admins can configure an alternative view of the JIRA View Issue screen for different groups. One of the items that can be configured is the ability to choose what fields are shown in the View Port. 

*Example Scenario*
You have a company that specialises in custom development solutions and have 10 internal staff members with 200 external customers. You want to manage all your issues in one JIRA project but you do not want to expose the time tracking fields to your customers.

*View Port Solution*
1. Admin creates a JIRA group for all the 'external customers'. 
2. Admin then creates a View Port for this group only.
3. Admin configures the View Port to show all fields except time tracking. 

When anyone in the 'external customers' group logs into a specific url, they are taken to this View Port. They will not be able to login into the normal JIRA system.

*Comments Please*
We'd love to get your feedback in this solution and if it would work for your company.
fields.summary: Alternative JIRA Views

fields.description:
For consistency, the *Copy Field Layout Configuration* admin page in JIRA should be renamed *Copy Field Configuration Scheme*.

When you:
* _Edit_ a field configuration scheme, the admin page name you land on is *Edit Field Configuration Scheme*.
* _Configure_ a field configuration scheme, the admin page name you land on is *Configure Field Configuration Scheme*.

So why should _Copy_ be any different?
fields.summary: For consistency, the "Copy Field Layout Configuration" admin page in JIRA should be renamed "Copy Field Configuration Scheme".

fields.description:
We are using a "Date Time" custom field for a project. We have a default date/time value set for this custom field. The default value is not displayed if you switch between projects using the project drop down menu at the top of the "Create Issue" lightbox screen. We are able to see the default custom field value if the "Create Issue" screen opens directly to this project.

Basically, if we were previously working with the project and attempt to create an issue, then we'll see the default value. In contrast, if we were working on a different project and select "Create Issue" and change the project on the create screen pop up, then we will not see the default value.
fields.summary: Custom Field Default Value is not Displayed if you switch between projects on the "Create Issue" Screen
Don't notify the issue editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27594].
  {panel}
h3. Problem Definition

There is no way to search via JQL to get accurate results in regards to issues / comments were a user has been @Mentioned For example, users have noted that you can sometimes get results for an advanced JQL query such as
{code:java}
comment ~ currentUser() 
{code}
However the ~ operator is unsupported for use with that function per [Advanced searching - functions reference - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/advanced-searching-functions-reference-939938746.html#Advancedsearching-functionsreference-currentUsercurrentUser()].

Also trying to search with a more basic set of terms like 
{code:java}
comment ~ username
{code}
can sometimes return results, but it is not providing consistent expected results (sometimes you see @ mentions here but not always), and  there does not appear to be a way to search via JQL for message content that includes @mentions

h3. Suggested Solution
* Creating a JQL function that can search for @ Mentions would be ideal
* Or extending the comment field to be searchable by user accounts mentioned within it

h3. Why this is important

It would be very helpful to be able to search, filter, and generally organize issues where you have been mentioned directly.

h3. Workaround
None

h3. Original description

Would like to be able to create a filter to track my AT mentions
fields.summary: JQL search for @mentions
Oracle Passwort

fields.description:
This issue directly relates to JRA-24558, which has been marked fixed for JIRA 4.4.3.

* Create a user in LDAP with mix case and have your connector directory synchronized in JIRA
* Now create an issue security scheme with security level restrricted to Assignees and reporters only

If the mix case user from LDAP creates an issue, he will be the reporter but he will still be restricted from viewing or searching the issue in the navigator or the project browser. He can however view the issue on visiting the issue url directly. *This is not the case with internal users.*

As a result of this, users are not able to implement the issue security scheme
fields.summary: Mixed case username from LDAP does not work with security schemes

fields.description:
- Run JIRA under "/jira" context (http://localhost:8080/jira)
- Go to UPM (plugin manager) and switch to install tab.
- Logout and login to JIRA

*Actual*: The AJS.conglomerate.cookie is saved under "/" (root context) with a value similar to:

__utma=111872281.2081964729.1332130805.1332130805.1332130805.1; __utmz=111872281.1332130805.1.1.utmcsr=(direct)|utmccn=(direct)|utmcmd=(none); AJS.conglomerate.cookie="||||||upm.tab=install; JSESSIONID=4D26AF92A8827231F3BAF4B7387DD6F2

Notice the missing closing quote in the value.

Now, attempt to login to Confluence running on http://localhost:8090. This cookie will be sent to confluence as well (since it is saved in root) and the application will fail to authenticate the user

Screen recording: http://screencast.com/t/6GwtrTAw

Notes:
- I am uncertain if the cookie will be set to this wrong value just by visiting this install tab (you might have to play a little with UPM to arrive at this state)
- We have confirmed that if the closing quote is added to the cookie, user is able to login successfully to Confluence.
fields.summary: AJS.conglomerate.cookie can be written with invalid data that prevents other Atlassian applications from logging in.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27573].
  {panel}

This entails:
1. Ability to add your own pop/imap servers
2. Ability to add a handler to create issues from #1
3. Ability to add a handler to add comments from #1

To support issue creation by email on OnDemand, JIRA needs to support SOCKS proxies for mail handlers.

See: https://sdog.jira.com/browse/JSTDEV-862
fields.summary: support issue creation by email on OnDemand

fields.description:
If you have wiki text in a comment or field then you can create thumbnails in wiki syntax like so

!jirahappydays.png|thumbnail!


However if you click on those thumbnails they dont show the image in the preview gallery but rather as the full image.

For example in this case its direct to :

https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/61617/61617_jirahappydays.png

The wiki produced HTML should have the class="gallery" rel=gallery" support so the light box can show them.

This changes needs to be made in the Wiki subsystem to include extra class and html attributes.


Also if you do this change it will help Bonfire since it uses wiki rendering to do some of its Session Notes rendering
fields.summary: The image gallery does not work with wiki text

fields.description:
In the object passed to AJS.Gadget to create the gadget, if view.args is a function, none of the returned information from the function is used when creating the args object passed to the view.template function.

This page (https://developer.atlassian.com/display/GADGETS/Creating+a+Gadget+JavaScript+Object) specifies that the input could be an array or function.
fields.summary: The view.args field does not support functions
Expose project catagories through REST
Provide report of old issue id -> new issue id

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27568].
  {panel}

When I create a new issue using browser Chrome I can select data from cascading fields:

example:
year: 2012 month: 01,02,03, etc.

When the issue is created an i want to change the entry in the 2nd row of the cascading field, the selection criteria won't appear (just a white list).

I can change that entry using Firefox, but not Chrome.

It would be very helpful if you could fix this bug.

The cascading field is a user-defined field.
fields.summary: No selection in cascading field when issue is edited using Chrome
Export to Excel in real xls, not in HTML

# Restore [^bad.zip].

We have now stopped the ability of the 'Anyone' group to be in the admin/sysadmin global permisison (see. JRA-22984). However, there may still be some old data sitting around where this exception occurs.
fields.summary: NPE thrown when trying to create a user where the 'Anyone' group has admin or sysadmin permission

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27557].
  {panel}

fields.description:
The problem:
* DefaultUserPropertyManager caches User->JiraCachingPropertySet and expires entries after 30 minutes of inactivity.
* DefaultUserPreferencesManager caches User->JiraUserPreferences and expires only to make more room after hitting 1000 entries.  JiraUserPreferences holds a reference to the JiraCachingPropertySet returned by the DefaultUserPropertyManager at the time of construction.
* These two interfaces are supposed to be backed by the same data, but since the DefaultUserPreferencesManager can hold onto JCPS references after  DefaultUserPropertyManager has discarded them, the system can get into an inconsistent state.

To reproduce:
* Log in as a user
* Navigate to the user's profile page
* Wait (a little over) 30 minutes
* Change the user's locale

Expected results:
* Provided the session has not timed out completely, the user's preferences should update normally and be applied immediately (the UI language should change).

Actual results:
* The results seem to update, but do not take effect
* The locale's value will be displayed correctly, but the translations are still in the previous language selection.
* This inconsistent state persists indefinitely

Workaround:
* Nothing simple.  It is not fixed by logging out and back in.

Technical note:
* You can reproduce this without the 30 minute wait by calling DefaultUserPropertyManager's psCache.invalidateAll() after the user has logged in.
fields.summary: Cached user properties data becomes stubbornly stale after 30 min

Steps to replicate:
# Create two projects, Project AAA (Key Project *AAA*) and Project BBB (Key Project *BBB*)
# Create an issue for Project AAA.  The newly created issue has the issue key AAA-1
# Configure _"Create Comment Mail Handlers"_ for Project BBB (Note that I did not configure the _"Create Comment Mail Handlers"_ for Project AAA)
!mailhandler.png!
# Send an email according the _"Create Comment Mail Handlers"_'s pop server, so that it will create a new issue for Project BBB
** The email's subject must have the issue key AAA-1.  Ie. Test Issue AAA-1 

By following the above steps, it should create a new issue with the summary _Test Issue AAA-1_ for project B.  However, JIRA handles this email as a comment for the issue AAA-1, rather than creating a new issue for project BBB.

h1. Steps to reproduce

1. In administration panel > Statuses menu, edit the "Close Event" and refer an external image icon, like: http://3layer.com.br/images/orange/16/Ok.png (see screenshot 1)

2. Create a sub-task that uses an workflow with the event above.

3. Promote the workflow of this sub-task until the referred close step.

4. Clone the sub-task above to another sub-task. This will create a standard "clone link" between them.

4. Open the clonned sub-task.

5. In the link panel area, see the reference to the original sub-task with the closed status and a empty image and look the error (see screenshot 2 - note that image are not displayed)

h1. Developer Tip:

Looking at page source, we deteced a mal-formed URL for the status image link (screenhot 3).

We think that in JSP/Velocity/something part of the page generation process, the Jira's forgotten to apply the rule "(relative to the JIRA web application e.g /images/icons OR *starting with http://*)" as mentioned in administration section (screenshot-1).

Thannks.

fields.description:
Hello team,
We discovered a bug on JIRA which if we edit the value of a required field on an original issue and then try to clone it, no error will be thrown and the issue will create a link to itself, instead creating a clone issue.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new issue and fill all the required fields.
2. Edit the issue and remove the value of one of those required fields.
3. Try to clone the issue. No error will be shown and the issue will create a link to itself (attached screenshot for better understanding).

Thanks,

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27539].
  {panel}

JQL needs something like:

now()=='Friday'

Use case:
As an Agile/Scrum/GreenHopper user we have an Agile project dashboard including a query for what we completed yesterday and what's assigned to us now.

This quick view is used extensively in the daily stand-up meetings where we normally present yesterdays work and current work.

This view fails us on Monday, as past day doesn't include friday or the occasional weekend work.

We can't use two queries because the dashboard views don't support such a thing.

We need a way for this query to work differently depending on the current day/time so that it can effectively be used in dashboard views.

Having a startOfDay(-1, 'BusinessDaysOnly') feature would be another solution to the problem.
fields.summary: JQL queries that vary by day of the week

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27532].
  {panel}

Setup
=====

We had one custom field named Progress of type Unlimited Text. It was restricted to one project and one issue type. 

Then we added another field named Progress of type Unlimited Text and only restricted it to the issue type, so making it used by all projects.

We then deleted the second field, so now there was only the one original field named Progress.

We did not reindex at any time, at least not using the Admin, Index screen.

Problem
=======

A JQL query with

"project = MYPROJ and issuetype = MyIssueType and Progress is not empty"

that worked before the changes now produced the error:

"Field 'Progress' is not searchable, it is only sortable."

However the following JQL query worked without errors:

"project = MYPROJ and issuetype = MyIssueType and cf[10200] is not empty"

10200 is the id of the original Progress field.

Which suggests to me that something stale can appear in the place where JQL looks up the custom field based on the name of the field.
fields.summary: Removing a custom field with duplicate name breaks JQL search, perhaps a stale cache?

  {panel}

Hi,

Since upgrading to 4.4 Labels in differnt charts are unreadable. I will attach an example Screenshot. 

The visual difference with the labeling is that before, labels on the X-Axis were not tilted 45 degrees. Therefore all those labels appeared just as a dotted line which I must admit was not readable either. But the point is that now labels appear as a big heap of pixels disturbing the complete layout of the graphics and making it too confusing to use it in reports (which we need to do very often). And we're not able to get rid of this. There is no gadget configuration to "do not tilt x-axis labels" and none to "turn axis labels off".

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Labels in charts unreadable due to massive ovelapping

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Set JIRA's session timeout to something short like 1 minute
2. Open the "quick create" dialog
3. Wait 1 minute until your session has timed out
4. Click "Create". The "session expired" page quickly flashes for a moment (!) , then you get this:

!http://i.imgur.com/rVtSX.png!

When this happens, you lose your submitted content (e.g. issue description, etc).

[~pcherukuri] and [~cdoble] both discovered this one while testing JRA-22667, but it's an existing bug in 5.0.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27508].

Steps to reproduce:

* click the "Create Issue" button and add an attachment
* open a new tab or window in the same browser (while keeping the "Create Issue" dialog open)
* click the "Create Issue" button and close the dialog, after it appeared
* change back to the first dialog
* click the "configure fields" and switch the mode from all to custom and back again
* [BUG] the attachment that was uploaded is now vanished

To reproduce the edit issue case, simply edit an issue, add an attachment and edit the same issue in another tab or window.
fields.summary: Opening a "Quick Create" dialog in parallel removes already added temporary attachments in other dialogs

fields.description:
When a frother control is "disabled", it really just means there's an element that overlays the field so it can't be clicked in to.

Naturally, this isn't "disabling" the field.

It's still possible to interact with it by:

* Using the keyboard to tab in to the field.
* Clicking the field's placeholder label, should it contain text that's larger than the allotted area for the placeholder label (an aside: why is this a label and not the html5 placeholder attribute?)

And because the form control is not disabled (i.e., it does not inherit the 'disabled' HTML attribute), its value will still be submitted to the server.

Please:
* Disable the form field itself by adding a disabled="disabled" attribute to it.
* Confine the width and height of the placeholder label such that it lives wholly inside the frother control. 
* Add an overflow: ellipsis to the placeholder label.
fields.summary: Disabled frother controls are not disabled enough

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27503].
  {panel}

It would be great to automatically generate "transitive" release notes - i.e. release notes including other release notes by aggregation.

Use cases:
1) in our appX, we're changing version of depX from 1.9 to 1.10 and we need to "publish" new depX-1.10's features as if they were appX's
2) in the upcoming version of our appX, we're reintegrating code from different projects (prjX, prjZ, etc.), and we need to merge their release notes
3) in bugfix release 3.0.4 we're only porting fixes of the older 2.2.9, so 3.0.4 is basically a one-issue-fixVersion with an almost-empty release note instead of the real, informative, one

In all cases we have:
- a transitive release note that we'd like to include/merge in the final one
- one or more issues (Tasks) representing the activity of updating/reintegrating/porting; these issues usually identify cleary and precisely the unique Project+FixVersion being somehow "included"
- the actual release note being non-informative

Would it be possible, while generating the release note, to replace these special/transitive issue with the referenced releaseNote?
fields.summary: Transitive Release Notes
